website_summaries.verdict: A fast-measuring pH meter with auto calibration.
pros: The automatic calibration and simple design make this a reliable pH meter for the home
It stands out for its quick read time and compact size
Despite the low price, this meter claims to measure with an accuracy of +/- 0.01 pH
Unlike many other inexpensive pH meters, this model has automatic temperature correction
cons: Some customers found this meter difficult to calibrate

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I got lucky. I'm impressed. This new PH-Meter is accurate and stable and the price was really good. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: bja

customer_reviews.title: Seems accurate, stable readings
customer_reviews.text: It's been accurate after 2 months use. Gives stable readings but wish it was waterproof. I always make sure not to dip the unit too far into the water but it's a concern every use
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and rugged
customer_reviews.text: I am making wine and titrate for total acids and need at least one decimal place accuracy. This unit worked well and used all day with same ph reading on my standard. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ph accuracy
customer_reviews.text: The device shape is good the live testing measure on the device screen is not stable or numbers keep fluctuate up and down. There is no led light on the display screen. The product is 3 star
customer_reviews.author: mohamed Ali

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Calibrate Properly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a month ago, calibrated it with the solution provided and it still wasn’t reading properly. I ordered two more calibration kits and used both to no avail. Not sure if my meter is faulty or not, but it doesn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy to use, good price. No issues with product.
customer_reviews.text: I use this PH sensor to lower the PH for my succulents, the city water PH is to high.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came with dead batteries
customer_reviews.text: Works good, but batteries that it came where DOA. After buying new batteries it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Slatton

customer_reviews.title: Complicated for use / useless
customer_reviews.text: At the 3-rd stage of calibration, it failed: "Error" 've appiard on the screen. There are no precise instructions for re-calibration there; and only one set of calibration powder agents. So, there is no way to test if the measurements are reliable or not. IMHO, the conclusion: nice idea, not developed enough technology as yet. Wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty accurate but is broken from I don't know I took good care of it. omw day it just kept jumping before I even put it water
customer_reviews.author: Kirk McGill

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Very useful to track Ph of your water periodically. Very handy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Nix2B

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap. It works.
customer_reviews.text: Nice economical and easy to use Ph meter for water.
customer_reviews.author: pluto1999

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: This meter is very easy to use, but that is the only good thing I can say about it. I followed the directios on the package insert. I calibrated it using the solution powders provided. It still measures distilled water at 5. Litmus paper shows it at 7 as it should, but the meyer says 5. That makes it entirely worthless to me. I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: This is VERY ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: This will save tons of time when shocking and adding acid. Its spot on to what to pro chemical test says.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Brown

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated.  Has to be calibrated first.
customer_reviews.text: When I buy stuff I want it ready for use. The manual says it needs to be calibrated. That means taking 3 × 250ml of distilled water at a specific temperature. Then you have to empty 3 packets of ph buffers and mixing them with water. Then follow not so clear instructions. So basically I'm not sure if I did it right so I'm unable to say if the readings are correct
customer_reviews.author: Pujdo

customer_reviews.title: Kills battery when turned off
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year using it to test my water on about a weekly basis. After not using it for a few months I found that it was dead, even though I shut it off. I replaced the batteries and made sure it was off before putting it away. The next day my brand new batteries were dead. It was drawing power even when turned off. I had to throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Moops

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Really, for the price you cannot go wrong. I recommend calibrating it before each use though as it will regularly go out of calibration if not used regularly. Also make sure that you store it in buffer solution as recommended by the manufacturer. Its a fraction of the price of one of the big name brand meters, and works pretty good for home brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hit the wrong button!
customer_reviews.text: Okay this thing is awesome and easy to use, only complaint is the calibration button is right on the front next to the on button and to my understanding if you press and hold it you’re gonna be screwed. Forced to recalibrate, at least. Which they include packets of material to calibrate with if that happens or if you need to recalibrate. Also a backlit lcd would be handy. Good unit though
customer_reviews.author: Jory Beck

customer_reviews.title: Usable for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works Ok. It's not for lab use but to check your pool, hot tub, hydro nutes yeah. Calibrates using three odd ph solutions, I only set the center, which is usually 7.0, this requires 6.86 pH, so. You need to add .14 to your actual reading after calibration.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, buy a Blue Lab!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this pH meter for a month and I hate it. As many times as I've tried calibrateing this with all 3 settings it never would fully calibrate. You can check the same sample 10 times and you will get a different pH reading everytime. I followed the instructions to a T and it has never worked properly since I've owned it ( a month now).
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great meter. This is my second one. I use this for ph testing my water for plants. No issues at all. Easy to calibrate, about use. I will be buying one more for a back up just in case. Great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Stealthgrows

customer_reviews.title: very poor qulaity device
customer_reviews.text: On the description this device appears to be very useful to test ph. The one I received did not even turn on. It looks that their quality control is shabby to let a broken device make to the market.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Amjad Aref

customer_reviews.title: fast / accurate / reliable
customer_reviews.text: Meter is easy to calibrate. Holds it calibration . Meter display is easy to read. Calibrated meter using lab certified solutions and have had no drifting or loss of accuracy. I would recommend this unit. You can't beat it for the price
customer_reviews.author: Patti Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this meter
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I bought this to make a beer. I did not get to test it out. When I was getting ready to start I went to calibrate it and it read err every time. I cleaned it and still got err on every try. Unfortunately the instructions are vague and there is no numbers or anything else to lead you to information. The name of the company is not even in the instructions. Lesson learned spend a few extra bucks and get one from a reputable company.
customer_reviews.author: Optometry gal

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to generally use but it was not even close to accurate. I tried calibrating but it just wouldn’t calibrate correctly. I made sure I was doing it as the instructions said and I looked up how to do it properly online. Everything I tried couldn’t get it to get accurate readings.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Hard to calibrate
customer_reviews.text: They don't make it easy to calibrate. Its a learning experience. They should have included 2 sets of test packets. Needless to say, I order more packets. I did use it and it seemed to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Slide

customer_reviews.title: Used
customer_reviews.text: It was wet with water as if it has been used. Really don’t want to be buying used products want to buy brand new
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Used is less than 10 times in a year before it stopped working. Won’t power on with new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical. This was the first time using such an instrument. Now I won't do without it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy maintenance
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to just rinse and dry it off instead of storing the probe in a solution. Compared against a different buffer solution to see if it is accurate at +/- 0.05 waiting only 5 seconds. Seems to equilibrate in less time than the recommended 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: DRov

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Can’t give it a five because I’m not sure how accurate it is but it works
customer_reviews.author: Dro Esco

customer_reviews.title: Fails to Calibrate
customer_reviews.text: It worked ok for about a month, but now fails to calibrate. Tried all 3 calibration settings, errors, out fails. Cheap POS
customer_reviews.author: DEF088

customer_reviews.title: No Instructions included with mine
customer_reviews.text: I got this PH Meter for aquarium use. The correct instructions for calibration would help a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri B Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Calibrates the first two solutions fine but never get the correct reading with the third, thought i was missing something so i tried calibrating it in the same cup of regular distilled water and each calibration read 6.86 then 4.01, its like its programmed to say whats its suppose to and doesn't actually work
customer_reviews.author: Euryleia

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable pH meter
customer_reviews.text: Results can't be trusted, even after calibration. It never reads anywhere near pH paper or liquid pH test drops.
customer_reviews.author: Mark McGee

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Had this delivered yesterday... I wanted a ph meter for my salt Water aquarium..followed the instructions.. this meter would not calibrate..horrible will be sending back
customer_reviews.author: Alex Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Unstable after about a month
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a week or so. Tried to use it the next month and readings were all over the place. Bought extra calibration kit and itiwasn't stable enough to calibrate. Worthless!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get the ph right
customer_reviews.text: Good product but I wasn’t aware I had to calibrate it
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: It may work, then it probably won't
customer_reviews.text: I calibrated and used it for a couple weeks, then it simply started giving woefully wrong results. If whatever you are taking PH of matters, use extreme caution. This is a poor quality device from a no-name company. Don't make my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: It’s actually garbage. If I wouldn’t have used be calibration packets already in an effort to get it to read remotely accurate, I’d be sending it back. Complete waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Gillmore

customer_reviews.title: Calibration will not hold for long
customer_reviews.text: Nice colors to bad it's not an ornament instead might as well be the ph calibration holds for about two days then skews dramatically so if accuracy is important go another route, as will I.
customer_reviews.author: Shayo

customer_reviews.title: Batteries were dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Batteries were dead on arrival. Spent $9 for batteries and it wasn't very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Frame

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working. Will only let me calibrate 6.86 ph and throws err message when trying to do steps 2. Not even 3 months of use. * seller warrantied defective items
customer_reviews.author: jbj

customer_reviews.title: Item stopped working, no response from the company.  Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: Item stopped working correctly. I contacted the company and received no response even though it is still under warranty. Poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen P.

customer_reviews.title: Good to go!
customer_reviews.text: I like the price, however I do not like how the numbers jump so much even after calibrating it multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Karau

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This is absolute TRASH! When I calibrated it, all 3 levels were off. I tested it in unopened store bought distilled water, my own distilled water and tap water. It reads commercial distilled water at 5.6 - 5.8 and not 7.0
customer_reviews.author: Craig E. Webb

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The meter errored out with every calibration. Impossible to calibrate
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Questionable
customer_reviews.text: I used this to test the ph of kombucha. It’s difficult to calibrate and temperamental. I don’t know if I can trust it
customer_reviews.author: Beatrice Kwidd

customer_reviews.title: Batteries should have been disengaged until customers install them
customer_reviews.text: Received ph meter yesterday. Would not power on. Checked batteries. Very corroded and acid drip marks inside and out of the meter. Cleaned up meter and bought new batteries and meter will still not power up
customer_reviews.author: shane snow

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: It had to be calibrated often....after several attempts I ran out of calibration solution. I reverted back to the solution drop method.
customer_reviews.author: David McAlpine

customer_reviews.title: Item as described
customer_reviews.text: We've used it a lot, but still feel like the papers and chemical testers are more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Norik T.

customer_reviews.title: Probably just look for another pen!
customer_reviews.text: Calibrated it multiple times next to a more expensive pH pen this thing is horrible! Not stable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Craps out after couple months
customer_reviews.text: It froze up and went crazy with numbers going up and down like it was under possession. It worked great for 6 months and crapped the bed... Booooooooo
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wilson

customer_reviews.title: works great after a little hassle. ph meter
customer_reviews.text: the directions suck and it wouldn't work right until I did a 3 point calibration. but after that, it works great and i am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: nathan a.

customer_reviews.title: Does not even turn on.
customer_reviews.text: Waiting a whole week to finally turn it on, only it doesn’t even turn on even with fresh new batteries. Disappointing to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: FayManBre

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Broke after about 2 months of use. Just reads “0” now.
customer_reviews.author: White man

customer_reviews.title: Came with dead batteries
customer_reviews.text: Came with dead batteries so I changed them. The calibration would not stay. went to use two days later and the batteries were dead again. Piece of crap!
customer_reviews.author: Laine

customer_reviews.title: It important to know what country produced item
customer_reviews.text: The meter didn’t read correctly. I was very disappointed. Testing ph level in my water
customer_reviews.author: cameron cooper

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, can’t seem to find the supplier
customer_reviews.text: Never worked, thought it was the calibration powder so I ordered a 15 pack Still erred out
customer_reviews.author: Mark Day

customer_reviews.title: good value for price
customer_reviews.text: good value for cost. great for beginners but not made for the long term use
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stepp

customer_reviews.title: Not working!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today. Product doesn’t turn on. Can be battery or not working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Renne Venceslau

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, easy to calibrate
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to calibrate and meets it's accuracy statements. Out of the box accuracy was good enough for most purposes (small scale hydroponics, food preservation, etc), calibrated this meter is almost as good as the $300 blue kit I have in the lab.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Giorgi

customer_reviews.title: Bad item
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a month and a half. I followed the calibration instructions and replaced batteries and the reading is stuck at 7.0 ph .
customer_reviews.author: Adrian barr

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Cheap as this is it works Great after I got it calibrated. I use it for checking PH in my discussion tank.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lippert

product_meta.title: Digital PH Meter, 0.01 PH High Accuracy Pocket Size PH Meter / PH Tester with 0-14.0 Measuring Range, Water Quality Tester for Household Drinking Water, Swimming Pools, Aquariums
